Posts.Content: kb1 wrote: I have my surgery tomorrow to discover whether or not the tumor is cancerous.  They are going to do an ultrasound with a wire to find exactly where the tumor is and then excise the tumor and surrounding tissue.  Then the pathologist will immediately do a frozen spot test on the tumor and determine if it is malignant.  If it is then they will remove my lymph nodes.  I will find out tomorrow what treatment I will need.  Hoping for the best but I am expecting the worst.  The surgeon couldn't find it at first but did find something he thought was it but still couldn't say for sure, hence the u/s with a wire to find it.  Hopefully things will go well.  If not then I will deal with what I have to.  Thanks to everyone for their support from earlier this week.  It has been a devasting blow.  I finally told my parents.  Bless them, they are in shock.  But, they will be with me. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: surgery tomorrow kb1 iodine

Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2007 05:48PM kb1 wrote: Thanks everyone.  I appreciate the thoughts.  I definitely need them.  It's been hard adjusting to the fact that I got a mamogram on Monday and now I am having surgery on Friday.  My mind is trying to grasp that fact.  I've never even had a hint of any problem before so this was a stunner.  Anyway, things will work out for the best one way or another.  Good luck corepat also.  My thoughts are with you too.  As soon as I can I will let everyone know.  Also to you WHB.  I hope you get the results you want and it's nice to know that you are up and around so soon.  If they have to remove the lymph nodes he said he would have to put in a drain so I'm thinking I won't be moving around too much.  But, that is if he has to remove them.  Trying to stay positive.
Posts.Title: surgery tomorrow kb1 iodine

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2007 11:54PM kb1 wrote: Thank you Poppy for your insight.  The not knowing is the hardest.  I had my mammogram last week Monday, Dec. 10 and surgery on Friday, Dec. 14 because of what they suspected.  It was the hardest 4 days of my life.  It was a solid mass but was benign and they were able to tell me that right after surgery.  I've been told over and over again on this website that 80% of things are benign.  Mine was and I had a hard time believing that statistic but for me it was true.  I hope the same for you.  Keep a positive mind.  It is hard.  I do understand that.  Hugs and best wishes.
Posts.Title: Getting scared miamigirl000 MsSherry

Posts.Content: kb1 wrote: I have just found out I have a mass in my right breast.  They did a mamagram then an ultrasound.  I meet with the surgeon tomorrow to determine if it is cancerous.  My gyno said the report show a tumor that was right above the aerola and down.  He couldn't really feel it when he tried today but the report said it was 2.4cm and it was lobular?  He said it was sort of shaped like a cauliflower.  Anyone know what that means?  He really didn't sound too optimistic.  It's not a cyst.  I know that.  I won't know until tomorrow what they are going to do but I am devastated and terrified.  There is no breast cancer in my family history.  I'm 43. Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2007 08:39AM kb1 wrote: kathyjo - Thank you for answering my question before I asked it.  It is comforting to know others are going through what I am.  I am trying not to panic but it is HARD!  Same to you for peace of mind and good results.  I'll post how it went.  Thanks for your thoughts.  It does help to know others feel like I do.

Posts.Content: kb1 wrote: I just had surgery.  I was wondering if the indentation of the tumor will be filled in later after surgery?  How long does it take for the breast to look semi normal? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Does the excised indentation go away kb1 AnneW

Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2007 08:34AM kb1 wrote: 3 weeks?  I don't think I can wait that long.  Holy cow.  Of course, this happens during the Christmas holidays so I'm sure there will be delays.  I had my mamogram Monday and they scheduled me to see the surgeon Thursday so I just hope they think it is important enough to get the biopsy done quickly. With the excisional biopsy, is there much pain?
Posts.Title: Meeting with surgeon tomorrow kb1 newgirl77

Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2007 08:19AM kb1 wrote: Thank you for your welcome and response leaf.  This has been quite devastating for me.  I never thought I would have anything like this.  I would like the surgeon to remove it tomorrow.  I don't know if he will or I will just get a consultation.  I am trying to be positive about the 80% thing but after talking to my gyno he wasn't too positive.  Although he did say that with no history in my family that was good.  It is the waiting that is the hardest.  But since they have found a tumor and measured it could it still be benign?  I just don't know how all that works.  I worry about what type of surgery I will have to have as well.  I guess I'll know tomorrow.
Posts.Title: Meeting with surgeon tomorrow kb1 newgirl77

Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2007 06:48PM kb1 wrote: Congratulations!!!!!  I know you are sooooo relieved.  I had my surgery Friday after having a bad mammogram on Monday and got a benign result so I celebrate your result also. The fear consumes all.  I definitely can relate to that. It was the worst 5 days of my life.  I also was lost and so afraid and this website was a godsend.  It helped me to try to get everything into perspective.  Everyone here is so upbeat and wonderful.  I'm glad everything is working out for you.  God bless and more happy days for you!
